title: Blotter, 1937
medium: Off-set lithograph on white wove paper, mounted on blue blotting paper
inscribed: Imprinted within a blue circle right center; zijn VLAK/blijven VLAK
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: A blue door opens at left, partially obscuring a framed landscape placed against a gray wall. Black and blue text on right side of blotter with calendar printed in blue at lower right. The blotter/calendar was a promotional object intended for the clients of the door manufactory. When the month indicated on the blotter ended, the blotter could be mounted on a manual rocking blotter holder, one of a number of assorted objects in a professional desk set.

tombstone.epitaph:
Blotter, 1937.
1937. Off-set lithograph on white wove paper, mounted on blue blotting paper. Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 2004-1-4.
